meanings.definition: To cut back a plant to the ground for new growth.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy rattooning my roses in the spring to help them grow better.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners often practice rattooning to encourage healthier plants.
meanings.sent3: The gardener joked that he was rattooning the bushes to give them a fresh start.
meanings.sent4: Rattooning the shrubs was like giving them a new lease on life.
meanings.sent5: The process of rattooning made the garden look rejuvenated and vibrant.

meanings.definition: The act of cutting back a plant for new growth.
meanings.sent1: After the rattooning, the garden showed signs of new life.
meanings.sent2: The rattooning of the bushes was necessary for their health.
meanings.sent3: The rattooning of the tree seemed like a magical transformation.
meanings.sent4: The rattooning process was like a reset button for the plants.
meanings.sent5: The gardeners admired the results of the rattooning on the flowerbeds.
